product_features.label: PF-CE-1.1
product_features.name: CE: Driver in, supervised operations
product_features.details:
* Supervised operation
  ** SDIC interfaces is defined by Terberg-1
  ** Protective stops as implemented by Terberg-1
  ** Terberg-1 safety envelope defined by Terberg-1
* Oxa RAD
  ** Incl HW integration compliance with Terberg-1 guidelines
  ** Incl SW integration compliance with Terberg-1 guidelines
* NO additional Oxa SW components

product_features.label: PF-CE-1.2
product_features.name: CE: Driver out, supervised operations
product_features.details:
* External operator (VLOS)
  ** Requirements on FORT controller and comms (eg latency, loss of comms), and integration with Terberg-1 HW/ SW (via FORT EPC into Terberg-1 SAFE_STOP)
* Remote operator (bVLOS)
  ** Requirements on RO controller and comms (eg latency, loss of comms), and integration with Terberg-1 HW/ SW (via FORT EPC into Terberg-1 SAFE_STOP)
  ** Comms requirements from AV to RO station (ie keep the teleop system separate from THIS CE marking ie we can then buy or build systems that satisfy these requirements.

product_features.label: PF-CE-1.3
product_features.name: CE: Driver out, constrained steering limits
product_features.details:
* Add Oxa Steering Rate limits on PL-d rated ECU
  ** This will reduce the required lateral clearance, thereby unlocking more operational domains

product_features.label: PF-CE-1.4
product_features.name: CE: Baseline port ODD and environmental conditions
product_features.details:
* Add baseline ODD and Environmental Conditions
* NOTE: Mostly SP (vs PP)

product_features.name: Straddled static objects: baseline
product_features.details: NONE
product_features.comments: LPO:  Why would we ever have an ability to avoid objects but not ones that straddle our lane?  It shouldn't be a separate capability, at either the product level, nor the tech level.  That's just setting the bar too low.

product_features.label: PF-OPS-1.1
product_features.name: AV System duty cycle management (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Service: Automatic service activation / deactivation (based on time, schedule, system status meeting criteria for planned service hours when the AV will automatically commence jobs it is aware of)
* Veh Admin: Remote boot and mode control
* Veh Admin: Automatic autonomy authorisation (based on estops, system health/battery, maintenance record, allowed hours, ODD conditions, scheduled downtime)
* Mission: Automatic retire to home
* Mission: Automatic retire for refueling

product_features.label: PF-OPS-2-1
product_features.name: Remote Vehicle Management (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Remote restarting of ACS services and devices
* Remote modification of vehicle config and env config
* Remote software updates
* Remote calibration management
* Performance metric viewer and short term history traces.

product_features.label: PF-OPS-3-1
product_features.name: Remote Data Management (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Live telemetry state available and viewable
* Automatic processing of HD data snippets
* Automatic upload management (concurrent, end-of-shift)
* Cloud access to data snippets
* Remote request to record HD Data

product_features.label: PF-OPS-4.1
product_features.name: Fleet Management (baseline)
product_features.details: * Continuous service, while hot-swapping vehicles

product_features.label: PF-XMS-2.1
product_features.name: Request a staging task (baseline)
product_features.details: * Stage until released at Map Pt X

product_features.label: PF-XMS-2.2
product_features.name: Request a staging task: Stage until released at location relative to CHE
product_features.comments: Noel: Should this be rolled into for example PF -CHE-1.1?

product_features.label: PF-XMS-3.1
product_features.name: Request a CHE interaction task (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Receive container from CHE at Map Pt X
* Deliver container to CHE at Map Pt X (decouple container from trailer)
product_features.comments: Noel: Should this be rolled into for example PF -CHE-1.1?

product_features.label: PF-XMS-3.2
product_features.name: Request a CHE Task: CHE-relative interactions
product_features.details:
* Receive container from CHE at a location relative to the CHE
* Deliver container to CHE at a location relative to the CHE (decouple container from trailer)
product_features.comments: Noel: Should this be rolled into for example PF -CHE-1.1?

product_features.label: PF-XMS-4.1
product_features.name: Parking Bay Tasking (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Deliver trailer to Parking Bay X
* Pick up trailer from Parking Bay X

product_features.label: PF-XMS-5.1
product_features.name: Dock Tasking (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Pick up trailer from Dock X
* Dock trailer at Dock X and wait
* Drop trailer at Dock X

capabilities.label: CA-FWD-1.1
capabilities.name: Traverse a corridor (AV only) while following the reference line

capabilities.label: CA-FWD-1.2
capabilities.name: Traverse a corridor (AV only) while following a prefered drive line (exemplars)
capabilities.details: How is this any differnet from CA-FWD-1.1??  Exemplars is just another name for reference lines.

capabilities.label: CA-FWD-1.3
capabilities.name: Traverse a corridor (AV only) while anticipating lane positioning (path pre-planning)
capabilities.details: Does this refer to turns (wide/overshoot turns) or selecting driveline for wide bidirectional lanes? Or both?

capabilities.label: CA-FWD-1.3.2
capabilities.name: Traverse a corridor (AV only) while anticipating lane positioning (ML free-space planner)

capabilities.name: Traverse a corridor (AV only) while adjusting lane positioning based on the scene (ML path hints)

capabilities.name: Tow a trailer while following the reference line

capabilities.name: Tow a trailer while following a prefered drive line

capabilities.name: Tow a trailer while adjusting lane positioning based on the scene (ML path hints)

capabilities.label: CA-FWD-3.1
capabilities.name: Lane borrow: tow a trailer on a multi-lane road
capabilities.details: This feels imprecise... What's the problem we're solving here?  Do we need to specify situations involving lane borrow? Like partial lane blockage vs overtaking a VRU, etc.?  What about borrowing a lane interval within a junction while completing a turn?

capabilities.label: CA-FWD-3.2
capabilities.name: Lane borrow: tow a trailer through a tight intersection
capabilities.details: By tight intersection... we mean, an intersection with a tight hard boundary on the inside corner, such that you need to overshoot to pull a wide sweep?
